title: In Central America, a devastating storm and an uncertain future
description: Central America's battle with Hurricane Eta could leave some countries scarred for generations.

title: Cracks grow in GOP defense of Trump's legal challenges
Tiger in the hunt at Masters after first round
description: A revitalized Tiger Woods drew on his vast experience at Augusta National to open his defense of the US Masters crown with a solid 4-under-par 68.

title: 'It's a slaughter': Doctor reacts to US Covid-19 numbers
description: Forty-four states see a rise in hospitalization as the number of daily new cases in the US nearly from just a few weeks ago. CNN's Erica Hill reports.

title: These Republicans publicly recognize Biden as President-elect
description: A growing number of notable Republicans are beginning to recognize Joe Biden as President-elect, even as President Donald Trump and many GOP leaders are still refusing to do so.

title: A tunnel can be built near England's Stonehenge -- and some people are upset
description: The British government has granted permission for the construction of a controversial tunnel near Stonehenge, an ancient UNESCO World Heritage Site of huge historical significance that dates back some 5,000 years.

title: The economy as we knew it might be over, Fed Chair says
description: The Covid-19 pandemic brought the economy to a screeching halt, and while it has started its long road to recovery, the economy we knew is probably a thing of the past, said Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Thursday.

title: Judge dismisses Trump campaign's lawsuit against CNN
description: A federal judge on Thursday dismissed a lawsuit President Donald Trump's campaign had filed against CNN for a 2019 opinion piece about former Special Counsel Robert Mueller's probe into Russian election meddling.

title: As Trump wrestles with defeat, pardons loom for allies -- and himself
description: President Donald Trump is refusing to concede the 2020 election to President-elect Joe Biden, but once Trump moves to the acceptance stage of his defeat, the urgent business of presidential pardons is likely to surge to the top of his checklist before leaving office.

title: Here's loophole on how Trump may be able to pardon himself
description: CNN's Special Correspondent Jamie Gangel and legal analyst Elliot Williams join Pamela Brown to discuss presidential pardons.

title: What Joe Biden's choice for chief of staff says about his plans for the presidency
At least 74 migrants killed in shipwreck off Libya coast, UN says
description: At least 74 migrants died in a shipwreck on Thursday off the coast of Khums, Libya, the United Nations' International Organization for Migration (IOM) said.

title: Why Trump is the clear front-runner for the 2024 nomination
description: President Donald Trump has yet for formally concede the 2020 presidential race, but he's already planning to run again in four years' time.

title: Kaley Cuoco says filming sex scenes with ex was 'sensitive'
description: Kaley Cuoco spoke about having to shoot "The Big Bang Theory" sex scenes with ex-boyfriend Johhny Galecki in an interview for Dax Shepard's podcast, "Armchair Expert."

title: Ghana's former president Jerry Rawlings dies
description: Jerry Rawlings, who seized control of Ghana twice in military coups before becoming the country's democratically-elected president, has died at the age of 73, his party said in a statement Thursday.

title: Sinéad O'Connor to enter a year-long treatment program for trauma and addiction
description: Sinéad O'Connor will enter a year-long treatment program for trauma and addiction and has postponed her 2021 shows in order to do so, O'Connor announced.

title: Hundreds of thousands evacuated as Typhoon Vamco hits the Philippines
description: Hundreds of thousands of people have been evacuated and many are still trapped on their rooftops after Typhoon Vamco made landfall in the Philippines on Wednesday night, hitting many of the same communities that were devastated by Super Typhoon Goni just 10 days before.

title: Why Trump is filing so many flimsy lawsuits in battleground states
description: The Trump campaign is moving from state to state to overturn President-elect Joe Biden's win, in a series of increasingly wild legal maneuvers without credible claims that face astronomical odds and carry little precedent.

title: Gun sales expected to set new records after Joe Biden's White House win
description: Joe Biden's projected White House win could boost gun sales in what has already been a landmark year for gun makers.

title: Emma Roberts becomes first pregnant Cosmopolitan cover star
description: Hollywood actor Emma Roberts has become the first pregnant woman to grace the cover of Cosmopolitan magazine.

title: Avlon: Republicans are coddling Trump out of fear of retaliation
description: CNN's John Avlon looks at why Republicans can't or won't congratulate President-elect Joe Biden in public.

title: Log on in paradise: The exotic destinations inviting remote workers
description: Working from home has become the new normal for many of us due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Boris Johnson has mismanaged Covid, Brexit and the economy. Now his inner circle is falling out
description: The UK is deep in its second wave of Covid-19 at the same time as Brexit enters its final act. This might seem enough to keep its leadership occupied.

title: Why are there fears of civil war in Ethiopia?
description: Ethiopia's prime minister Abiy Ahmed has said that concerns his country will descend into chaos are unfounded, but fears of an all-out civil war continue to grow.

title: British nurse charged with murder of eight babies appears in court
description: A British nurse has appeared in court charged with eight counts of murder and 10 counts of attempted murder following an investigation into a number of baby deaths at a hospital in Cheshire, northwestern England.

title: New Japanese theme park attraction lets guests zipline into Godzilla's mouth
description: In what could be viewed as a fitting metaphor for 2020, a new theme park ride in Japan lets guests zipline into the gaping mouth of a massive Godzilla statue.

title: I quarantined in Beijing, Tokyo and Hong Kong. Here's what I learned
description: Of the past 148 days, I've spent nearly one-third of them in quarantine. I started in Beijing and have journeyed to Hong Kong and now Tokyo.

title: Man exonerated after serving 15 years for a murder he didn't commit
description: After serving 15 years for a brutal murder, a Tennessee man has been exonerated by a judge who ruled he was wrongly convicted.

title: What architecture could look like after Covid-19
description: As the world continues to battle coronavirus, designers are re-imagining how public spaces can let people come together, while keeping them safe.

title: Europe is coming for Big Tech. Biden's victory won't change that
description: Europe has turned itself into the cop on the Big Tech beat, repeatedly enforcing its rules and hitting the industry's top American companies with huge fines. That's not going to change when Joe Biden is sworn in as US president.

title: Beijing gives up on even the pretense of allowing opposition in Hong Kong
Justin Bieber make his debut at the CMA Awards
description: Country music stars Darius Rucker and Reba McEntire co-hosted the 2020 Country Music Association Awards celebrating the legends and rising stars of the genre. CNN takes a look at the most memorable moments.

title: What it could take to deliver a Covid-19 vaccine to the world
description: An approved vaccine for Covid-19 could be forthcoming, after the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine candidate was reported to be more than 90% effective in preventing infection in volunteers. However, the next steps could be just as challenging. CNN's Anna Stewart reports on how global companies are preparing for storing, transporting and distributing millions of doses.

title: Japanese town deploys 'Monster Wolf' robots to deter wild bears
description: A Japanese town has deployed robot wolves to scare off bears that have become an increasingly dangerous nuisance in the countryside.

title: Biden names Ron Klain as his chief of staff
description: President-elect Joe Biden on Wednesday tapped Ron Klain to be his incoming chief of staff, elevating his longtime aide to one of the most powerful positions in the White House, officials familiar with the move told CNN.

title: Magic wall: Biden's popular vote lead is highest margin in 20 years
description: CNN's Phil Mattingly walks through where President Trump and President-elect Biden stand as the final votes are being counted in the 2020 presidential election.

title: Choosing the best mask to protect you and others, according to new CDC guidelines
description: It's official -- wearing a mask not only protects others from your expelled respiratory droplets, it protects you as well, according to new guidance from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Joe Biden's win grows more decisive each day
Hong Kong pro-democracy lawmakers to resign en masse
description: Four pro-democracy Hong Kong lawmakers were stripped of their seats on Wednesday after Beijing passed a resolution giving local authorities broad new powers to quash dissent, in a move that could signal the end of political opposition in the city.

title: Robots are joining the fight against coronavirus in India
description: In India, the country with the world's second-highest number of Covid-19 cases, a handful of hospitals has started to use robots to connect patients with their loved ones, and assist healthcare workers on the frontlines of the pandemic.

title: Bernie Sanders says he'd accept Biden cabinet spot
description: Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders said Wednesday that he would accept the job of Labor secretary if President-elect Joe Biden asked him to join his Cabinet.
